abstract: Investors pushed the Dow and S.&P. 500 down to 1997 levels as losses piled up in technology and major industrial companies.
snippet: Investors pushed the Dow and S.&P. 500 down to 1997 levels as losses piled up in technology and major industrial companies.
lead_paragraph: On a day when two leading stock indexes sank to their lowest point in more than a decade, Wall Street did not need the dire problems of banks to lead the way to the bottom.

headline.main: Stocks Slump on Corporate Woes; Indexes Fall by 3.4%
headline.print_headline: Buyers Flee As S.&P. And Dow Hit 12-Year Lows
